First post introducing this blog and what I'll be writing about.

This is my first blog post on this website. I've long wanted to publish a website - but I keep on getting caught up in vendor complications (Squarespace, Convertkit, Webflow, Framer, etc.). What has allowed me to create this is what's interesting about it: the entire website was coded by myself.

Despite the fact that I have no experience in coding and couldn't code myself out of a cardboard box.

I entirely used AI to create the file system, learn how to use Github, sync it with Cloudflare as my CDN and run it through their Pages service. The cost - total - for the entire website is under ~$11. Amazing.

## What This Blog Is About

I'll be writing about:
- Marketing strategy and audience development
- Insights from working in media and entertainment
- Cultural thoughts as we build new institutions
- What Relevant Radio and our incredible team is up to
- Productivity and entrepreneurship
- Psychology, philosophy, and new science
- Building systems that allow for exponential growth
- And much much more.

## Why I'm Writing

Writing clarifies thinking. Writing helps me develop thoughts, communicate them to others, and grow in relationship with God and others. This blog is a space to work through ideas, share what I'm learning, and connect with others.

## What's Next

I'll be publishing regularly. I plan on putting together an email subscription at some point soon. And I'll also be using AI to continue developing this website and set of features. Pretty amazing stuff!

Stay tuned...

I don't know how to code - but I'm working in Visual Studio, committing new updates to my code repository on Github, and publishing a blog that was delayed for years.

AI makes that possible.

## AI Makes that Possible

In a world of AI, there are very few moats to industry - few obstacles that can prevent motivated people from moving things forward.

I'm finally publishing a blog that I've thought about for years. Why? AI certainly helped.

## Where AI Can't Help

By now most of us have heard of slop. AI slop, that is. It's when people use AI to generate videos or graphics or text that is obviously below a certain standard, that, generally speaking, human beings hold themselves to. 

It's caused people to fear that the use of AI in content creation is going to lead to a deluge of low-quality content. 

But where AI really should be used is in the systems and operations that surround human beings creating content. AI can help with gathering bibliographies, summarizing large amounts of research and data, and coming up with plans to help you execute in any production. 

AI can be an exceptional helper when it comes to producing content or developing ideas. But we need to be careful that we don't delegate away the aspects of content creation that make them uniquely human.

I don’t know how to code - but I’m working in Visual Studio, committing new updates to my code repository on Github, and publishing a blog that was delayed for years.

AI makes that possible.

AI Makes that Possible

In a world of AI, there are very few moats to industry - few obstacles that can prevent motivated people from moving things forward.

I’m finally publishing a blog that I’ve thought about for years. Why? AI certainly helped.

Where AI Can’t Help

By now most of us have heard of slop. AI slop, that is. It’s when people use AI to generate videos or graphics or text that is obviously below a certain standard, that, generally speaking, human beings hold themselves to.

It’s caused people to fear that the use of AI in content creation is going to lead to a deluge of low-quality content.

But where AI really should be used is in the systems and operations that surround human beings creating content. AI can help with gathering bibliographies, summarizing large amounts of research and data, and coming up with plans to help you execute in any production.

AI can be an exceptional helper when it comes to producing content or developing ideas. But we need to be careful that we don’t delegate away the aspects of content creation that make them uniquely human.
